channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report E-2024010472
item.description:
Report E-2024010472

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 22, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN1325 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged container was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024010644
item.description:
Report X-2024010644

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-30
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024010644 SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection of "MEDIVATORS RAPICIDE PA" showed closures torn open, wet from internal leakage, with 1 loose cap. Damage most likely caused from being placed on the wrong conveyor belt. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated. 2. X-2024010648 SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION 1 BOTTLE OF RAPICIDE PART B WAS FOUND TO BE MISSING AND ONE BOTTLE OF PART A TO BE SLIGHTLY LEAKING. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF RAPICIDE CAUSED FROM PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OF MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.
